vague_description: The village needs to determine the optimal combination of bikes and cars to transport a minimum number of people, while adhering to capacity constraints and keeping car usage within a specified proportion.
detailed_description: A village hosts a banquet and provides bike and car transportation for everyone. A bike can take \param{BikeCapacity} people while a car can take \param{CarCapacity} people. Since cars are more expensive, at most \param{MaxCarProportion} of the vehicles can be cars. If the village needs to transport at least \param{MinPeople} people, how many of each vehicle should be used to minimize the total number of bikes needed?
target_objective: Minimize the total number of bikes needed for transportation
target_constraints: Each bike can transport at most BikeCapacity people
Each car can transport at most CarCapacity people
At most MaxCarProportion of the total number of vehicles can be cars
At least MinPeople must be transported
target_parameters: Maximum proportion of transport vehicles that can be cars
Minimum number of people that need transport
